item.title: Linux Security Modules
item.description: Disclaimer: I threw these notes together for CU Boulder’s Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition team for spring 2020. There may be some inaccuracies, and parts of the notes are still incomplete. Introduction The Linux kernel has a built-in discretionary access control (DAC) system for controlling system resources. DACs are characterized by the fact that the owner of a resource may grant somebody else access to that resource; for instance, in Linux, the owner of a file could run chmod +rwx myfile to give every user on the system read, write, and execute permissions to the file.
